I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.
