I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. What is OPA?OPA is an open-source policy engine that uses a declarative language called Rego to write policies as code. It integrates seamlessly with microservices, Kubernetes, Terraform, and more.Real-Time Examples:Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Microservices Authorization: Enforce fine-grained access control with OPA.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Kubernetes Admission Controller: Validate and enforce custom policies on Kubernetes resources.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Terraform Policy Enforcement: Ensure compliance and safety in Terraform configurations.Â· API Gateway Authorization: Integrate OPA with Envoy for edge-level authorization.Extending OPA:Use plugins like OPAL to enhance OPA with dynamic policy updates and data synchronizationhashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Cybersecurity hashtag#CTO hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

It integrates seamlessly with microservices, Kubernetes, Terraform, and more.Real-Time Examples:Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Microservices Authorization: Enforce fine-grained access control with OPA.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Kubernetes Admission Controller: Validate and enforce custom policies on Kubernetes resources.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Terraform Policy Enforcement: Ensure compliance and safety in Terraform configurations.Â· API Gateway Authorization: Integrate OPA with Envoy for edge-level authorization.Extending OPA:Use plugins like OPAL to enhance OPA with dynamic policy updates and data synchronizationhashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Cybersecurity hashtag#CTO hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation

# Hiring We are looking for " Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) " Location: Bengaluru/ MumbaiEEmployment Type: C2HDepartment: IT / Database AdministrationJob Summary:We are seeking an experienced Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing our Azure SQL Database environments. Key Responsibilities:Database ManagementPerformance Tuning & Database Monitoring Security & ComplianceBackup & RecoveryAutomation & Scripting:Use PowerShell, Azure CLI, or T-SQL to automate repetitive tasks, database maintenance.Database MonitoringCollaboration & SupportDocumentation & Best PracticesRequired Skills and Qualifications:Experience:5+ years of experience as a SQL DBA, with significant experience in Azure SQL Database management and administration.Strong hands-on experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, and SQL Server in both cloud and hybrid environments.Technical Skills:Proficiency with T-SQL, Azure CLI, PowerShell, and other SQL-related scripting languages.In-depth knowledge of database performance tuning, indexing, query optimization, and capacity planning.Experience with Azure SQL Database Backup, Restoration, Replication, and High Availability (Always On, Geo-Replication, etc.).Cloud & Security:Experience managing databases in Azure, with a strong understanding of Azure Security and Compliance policies.Knowledge of Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and managed identities.Tools & Monitoring:Experience using Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Insights, or third-party monitoring tools for database health checks, performance monitoring, and alerting.Preferred Skills:Certifications:Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate or other relevant certifications are preferred.Additional Skills:Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, or Azure Synapse Analytics.Familiarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) in an Azure context.DevOps Practices: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for database deployments and integration into DevOps processes.If skills match with your profile kindly send your updated resume ASAP to Kalyan.v@decimalbs.comhashtag#AzuredatabaseAdministrator.

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

hashtag#hiring *Data Warehouse Developer & ETL Developer*, New York City, *United States*, all hashtag#opentowork hashtag#NewYorkCityjobs hashtag#NewYorkjobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/gCKk5Pqu We're looking for a passionate Data Warehouse Engineer to join our team and drive our data operations to new heights. In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining a robust data warehouse that supports large-scale data activities across various sources. You'll collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Sales to identify and address data and reporting needs.Your expertise in cloud data warehousing, particularly with Azure services, is essential. You'll be adept at data integration methodologies (ELT/ETL) and skilled in data modeling across different formats. Proficiency in SQL and Python for data movement and processing is a must. Experience with Azure, Apache Spark, and Microsoft Fabric will be highly valued.Key Responsibilities:Design and develop new data products tailored to business requirements.Maintain and enhance the internal data warehouse and reporting systems to maximize their impact.Implement QA processes for comprehensive testing from data ingestion to visualization.Work closely with stakeholders to define data and reporting needs.Create and maintain efficient, testable data pipelines in Python.Elevate the data warehouse by improving data timeliness and solidifying reusable data assets.Develop visualizations and reports using tools like SSRS and Tableau.Utilize version control systems (e.g., Azure DevOps) and agile project management tools (e.g., Jira).Transform data into traditional data warehouse schemas and ensure high-volume database system support.Skills and Experience:Proficient in designing data warehouses using Redshift.Strong programming skills in SQL and Python.Deep understanding of SQL-based Big Data systems and modern ETL tools.Mastery of database and data warehouse methodologies, from transactional databases to dimensional data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Experience with SSIS or similar ETL tools.Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.Welcome to ConsultNet and the family of companies, Tekne, SaltClick, TechBridge, and OmniMedia. As a premier national provider of technology talent and solutions, our expertise spans across project services, contract-to-hire, direct placement, and managed services both onshore and nearshore.

# Hiring We are looking for " Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) " Location: Bengaluru/ MumbaiEEmployment Type: C2HDepartment: IT / Database AdministrationJob Summary:We are seeking an experienced Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing our Azure SQL Database environments. Key Responsibilities:Database ManagementPerformance Tuning & Database Monitoring Security & ComplianceBackup & RecoveryAutomation & Scripting:Use PowerShell, Azure CLI, or T-SQL to automate repetitive tasks, database maintenance.Database MonitoringCollaboration & SupportDocumentation & Best PracticesRequired Skills and Qualifications:Experience:5+ years of experience as a SQL DBA, with significant experience in Azure SQL Database management and administration.Strong hands-on experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, and SQL Server in both cloud and hybrid environments.Technical Skills:Proficiency with T-SQL, Azure CLI, PowerShell, and other SQL-related scripting languages.In-depth knowledge of database performance tuning, indexing, query optimization, and capacity planning.Experience with Azure SQL Database Backup, Restoration, Replication, and High Availability (Always On, Geo-Replication, etc.).Cloud & Security:Experience managing databases in Azure, with a strong understanding of Azure Security and Compliance policies.Knowledge of Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and managed identities.Tools & Monitoring:Experience using Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Insights, or third-party monitoring tools for database health checks, performance monitoring, and alerting.Preferred Skills:Certifications:Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate or other relevant certifications are preferred.Additional Skills:Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, or Azure Synapse Analytics.Familiarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) in an Azure context.DevOps Practices: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for database deployments and integration into DevOps processes.If skills match with your profile kindly send your updated resume ASAP to Kalyan.v@decimalbs.comhashtag#AzuredatabaseAdministrator.

This is where DevOps comes in as a transformative approach that merges the once disparate functions of Dev and Ops into a cohesive powerhouse.ğŸ”§ **ğ„ğŸğŸğ¢ğœğ¢ğğ§ğœğ² ğ“ğ¡ğ«ğ¨ğ®ğ ğ¡ ğ€ğ®ğ­ğ¨ğ¦ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§**: By automating manual processes across development, testing, deployment, and operations, DevOps streamlines workflows, reduces errors, and accelerates time to market. Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) pipelines ensure that code moves seamlessly from development through testing and into production environments without friction.ğŸ¤ **ğğ«ğğšğ¤ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğƒğ¨ğ°ğ§ ğ’ğ¢ğ¥ğ¨ğ¬**: DevOps promotes a culture of collaboration and shared responsibility. It breaks down traditional silos between teams, fostering cross-functional communication and understanding. Developers gain insights into operational challenges, while operations teams understand the intricacies of software development. This alignment leads to quicker issue resolution and improved overall product quality.ğŸ” **ğŒğ¨ğ§ğ¢ğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğšğ§ğ ğ…ğğğğ›ğšğœğ¤ ğ‹ğ¨ğ¨ğ©ğ¬**:Â With integrated monitoring and feedback loops, DevOps enables teams to gather real-time insights into application performance and user behavior. This proactive approach allows for rapid iteration and continuous improvement based on data-driven decisions.ğŸŒŸ **ğ„ğ§ğ¡ğšğ§ğœğğ ğğ«ğ¨ğğ®ğœğ­ğ¢ğ¯ğ¢ğ­ğ² ğšğ§ğ ğˆğ§ğ§ğ¨ğ¯ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§**: By eliminating bottlenecks and reducing deployment times, DevOps empowers teams to focus more on innovation and delivering value to end-users. Developers can experiment with new features and functionalities, knowing they have the support of robust deployment pipelines and automated testing frameworks.ğŸ“ˆ **ğğ®ğ¬ğ¢ğ§ğğ¬ğ¬ ğ€ğ ğ¢ğ¥ğ¢ğ­ğ²**: Ultimately, DevOps is not just a technical approach but a strategic enabler of business agility. Organizations that embrace DevOps practices are better equipped to respond to market changes, scale operations efficiently, and maintain a competitive edge in today's digital economy.ğŸ”— **ğ‰ğ¨ğ¢ğ§ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ…ğ¨ğ«ğœğğ¬**: Let's continue to champion the principles of DevOpsâ€”collaboration, automation, monitoring, and feedbackâ€”as we redefine how software development and operations work together. I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

What is OPA?OPA is an open-source policy engine that uses a declarative language called Rego to write policies as code. It integrates seamlessly with microservices, Kubernetes, Terraform, and more.Real-Time Examples:Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Microservices Authorization: Enforce fine-grained access control with OPA.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Kubernetes Admission Controller: Validate and enforce custom policies on Kubernetes resources.Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Terraform Policy Enforcement: Ensure compliance and safety in Terraform configurations.Â· API Gateway Authorization: Integrate OPA with Envoy for edge-level authorization.Extending OPA:Use plugins like OPAL to enhance OPA with dynamic policy updates and data synchronizationhashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Cybersecurity hashtag#CTO hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#Hiring hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation

# Hiring We are looking for " Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) " Location: Bengaluru/ MumbaiEEmployment Type: C2HDepartment: IT / Database AdministrationJob Summary:We are seeking an experienced Azure SQL Database Administrator (DBA) to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing our Azure SQL Database environments. Key Responsibilities:Database ManagementPerformance Tuning & Database Monitoring Security & ComplianceBackup & RecoveryAutomation & Scripting:Use PowerShell, Azure CLI, or T-SQL to automate repetitive tasks, database maintenance.Database MonitoringCollaboration & SupportDocumentation & Best PracticesRequired Skills and Qualifications:Experience:5+ years of experience as a SQL DBA, with significant experience in Azure SQL Database management and administration.Strong hands-on experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, and SQL Server in both cloud and hybrid environments.Technical Skills:Proficiency with T-SQL, Azure CLI, PowerShell, and other SQL-related scripting languages.In-depth knowledge of database performance tuning, indexing, query optimization, and capacity planning.Experience with Azure SQL Database Backup, Restoration, Replication, and High Availability (Always On, Geo-Replication, etc.).Cloud & Security:Experience managing databases in Azure, with a strong understanding of Azure Security and Compliance policies.Knowledge of Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and managed identities.Tools & Monitoring:Experience using Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Insights, or third-party monitoring tools for database health checks, performance monitoring, and alerting.Preferred Skills:Certifications:Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate or other relevant certifications are preferred.Additional Skills:Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, or Azure Synapse Analytics.Familiarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) in an Azure context.DevOps Practices: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for database deployments and integration into DevOps processes.If skills match with your profile kindly send your updated resume ASAP to Kalyan.v@decimalbs.comhashtag#AzuredatabaseAdministrator.

ğŸ‘‹ Namstey ğŸ™ Friends ğŸ‘ğŸš€ ğ‘¬ğ’ğ’ƒğ’“ğ’‚ğ’„ğ’Šğ’ğ’ˆ ğ‘«ğ’†ğ’—ğ‘¶ğ’‘ğ’”: ğ‘»ğ’“ğ’‚ğ’ğ’”ğ’‡ğ’ğ’“ğ’ğ’Šğ’ğ’ˆ ğ‘«ğ’†ğ’—ğ’†ğ’ğ’ğ’‘ğ’ğ’†ğ’ğ’• ğ’‚ğ’ğ’… ğ‘¶ğ’‘ğ’†ğ’“ğ’‚ğ’•ğ’Šğ’ğ’ğ’” ğ’Šğ’ğ’•ğ’ ğ’‚ ğ‘¼ğ’ğ’Šğ’‡ğ’Šğ’†ğ’… ğ‘­ğ’ğ’“ğ’„ğ’† ğŸŒIn today's fast-paced tech landscape, the collaboration between development (Dev) and operations (Ops) teams isn't just beneficialâ€”it's essential for achieving agile and efficient delivery of software products. This is where DevOps comes in as a transformative approach that merges the once disparate functions of Dev and Ops into a cohesive powerhouse.ğŸ”§ **ğ„ğŸğŸğ¢ğœğ¢ğğ§ğœğ² ğ“ğ¡ğ«ğ¨ğ®ğ ğ¡ ğ€ğ®ğ­ğ¨ğ¦ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§**: By automating manual processes across development, testing, deployment, and operations, DevOps streamlines workflows, reduces errors, and accelerates time to market. Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) pipelines ensure that code moves seamlessly from development through testing and into production environments without friction.ğŸ¤ **ğğ«ğğšğ¤ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğƒğ¨ğ°ğ§ ğ’ğ¢ğ¥ğ¨ğ¬**: DevOps promotes a culture of collaboration and shared responsibility. It breaks down traditional silos between teams, fostering cross-functional communication and understanding. Developers gain insights into operational challenges, while operations teams understand the intricacies of software development. This alignment leads to quicker issue resolution and improved overall product quality.ğŸ” **ğŒğ¨ğ§ğ¢ğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğšğ§ğ ğ…ğğğğ›ğšğœğ¤ ğ‹ğ¨ğ¨ğ©ğ¬**:Â With integrated monitoring and feedback loops, DevOps enables teams to gather real-time insights into application performance and user behavior. This proactive approach allows for rapid iteration and continuous improvement based on data-driven decisions.ğŸŒŸ **ğ„ğ§ğ¡ğšğ§ğœğğ ğğ«ğ¨ğğ®ğœğ­ğ¢ğ¯ğ¢ğ­ğ² ğšğ§ğ ğˆğ§ğ§ğ¨ğ¯ğšğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§**: By eliminating bottlenecks and reducing deployment times, DevOps empowers teams to focus more on innovation and delivering value to end-users. Developers can experiment with new features and functionalities, knowing they have the support of robust deployment pipelines and automated testing frameworks.ğŸ“ˆ **ğğ®ğ¬ğ¢ğ§ğğ¬ğ¬ ğ€ğ ğ¢ğ¥ğ¢ğ­ğ²**: Ultimately, DevOps is not just a technical approach but a strategic enabler of business agility. Organizations that embrace DevOps practices are better equipped to respond to market changes, scale operations efficiently, and maintain a competitive edge in today's digital economy.ğŸ”— **ğ‰ğ¨ğ¢ğ§ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ…ğ¨ğ«ğœğğ¬**: Let's continue to champion the principles of DevOpsâ€”collaboration, automation, monitoring, and feedbackâ€”as we redefine how software development and operations work together. Together, we can drive innovation, accelerate delivery cycles, and build resilient, high-performing IT ecosystems.Aman Gupta Ashish Kumar DevOps Insiders Akkshay A Sharma Satya Prakash
